data.name: CellEditors_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the use of WebDataInput controls within the cells of the UltraWebGrid.  Each control has various ways to implement allowing more flexibility.  Notice the same controls used in very different ways below.

data.name: CellEditors_Description2
data.value: DataInput Components used in the cells of the Grid:

data.name: CellEditors_Description3
data.value: Mask - WebMaskEdit (Notice how the format is maintained when typing a phone number into the cell.  This control will not allow unwanted or extraneous characters in the cell.)

data.name: CellEditors_Description4
data.value: Double - WebNumericEdit (This control maintains the decimal point value.  Notice the up and downbuttons when clicked the number will increment/decrement to the next whole number)

data.name: CellEditors_Description5
data.value: Range: -9.90000 - WebCurrencyEdit (This control maintains the decimal the dollar value.  Rounding numbers up to the nearest 10th.  Notice the buttons, when clicked, will increment/decrement the number to the next whole dollar.)

data.name: CellEditors_Description6
data.value: Short - WebNumericEdit (Notice when a number above 32,767 is entered in the cell, this control automatically puts it back to its maximum allowed in short format)

data.name: CellEditors_Description7
data.value: Date - WebDateTimeEdit (This control is being used to maintain the short date format. Notice the up/down buttons. Depending on the section of the date the cursor is in, will determine which part of the date is incremented/decremented. Try to increment the day of the month by 2, and then try decrementing the year by 2)

data.name: CellEditors_Description8
data.value: Range: 1/1/1920-12/31/2090 - WebDateTimeEdit (Notice how this control is being used to specify a specific date range.  The formatting is also shown in mask edit format, making sure the user maintains the format desired by the developer.)

data.name: ClientSide_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the use of client side events within a webdatainput control.

data.name: ClientSide_Description2
data.value: Current Date - WebDateTimeEdit (on page load the Current date and time are displayed within the control.  it will keep track of time while on the page.  Resets each time you refresh the page)

data.name: ClientSide_Description3
data.value: Chronometer - WebDateTimeEdit (the spinners control the speed in which the timer increments)

data.name: ClientSide_Description4
data.value: Hex Filter - WebTextEdit (this input will only accept Hexadecimal characters)

data.name: ClientSide_Description5
data.value: Show output events -  WebDateTimeEdit (this example displays the events of the webDateTimeEdit control the control is moused over/out and clicked)

data.name: ClientSide_Label4
data.value: Show invalid value and output events

data.name: CultureFormats_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates setting webdatainput controls dynamically by setting an option in a drop down menu.

data.name: CultureFormats_Description2
data.value: Select a country in the drop down list.

data.name: CultureFormats_Description3
data.value: Check the "Apply to 1st date..." check box.

data.name: CultureFormats_Description4
data.value: Use the spin button in the editors to see how the content is changed.

data.name: CultureFormats_Description5
data.value: Highlight the content of an editor to change a value.  Notice how the mask editing is based on the selected culture.

data.name: CultureFormats_Header
data.value: Dynamic Web Data Inputs based on Country

data.name: CultureFormats_Tooltip_1
data.value: Long-date, long-time format. Null is not allowed

data.name: CultureFormats_Tooltip_2
data.value: Short-date, short-time format. Null is not allowed

data.name: CustomFormats_Description_1
data.value: This sample demonstrates custom fomatting for DateTime and Currency Formats

data.name: CustomFormats_Description_2
data.value: Try the following in the Date/Time Format Example:

data.name: CustomFormats_Description_3
data.value: Select different options from the Culture list, Edit format (for masking), Display Format, Date Seperator.  Results are show in the target input control.

data.name: CustomFormats_Description_4
data.value: Change the spelling of a month, abbreviate a month.  Notice how it changes in the target input control.

data.name: CustomFormats_Description_5
data.value: Edit the target Input control to see how the different options effect masking.

data.name: CustomFormats_Description_6
data.value: Try the following in the Currency Format Example:

data.name: CustomFormats_Description_7
data.value: Change some of the text input fields, select different options from the drop down menus.  Results are show in the target input control.

data.name: CustomFormats_Description_8
data.value: Edit the target Input control to see how the different options effect masking.

data.name: DateEditors_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the versatility of the WebDateTimeEdit Control.

data.name: DateEditors_Description2
data.value: Click the spin buttons to view how each control increments.

data.name: DateEditors_Description3
data.value: Edit the contents of each control to see how each control depending on it's display setting has different mask editing.

data.name: DateEditors_Description4
data.value: Highlight specific sections (day, hour, minutes, seconds, etc.) then click the spin buttons up or down.  Notice how each part of the date/time can be incremented individually.

data.name: DropDownCalendars_Description1
data.value: This sample shows how client side events of WebTextEdit and WebCalendar can be used to establish drop-down functionality.  Note: The drop-down calendar appears as child control of document rather than as a top-window frame.

data.name: DropDownCalendars_Description2
data.value: Notice the versatility of the controls such as the location of the spin buttons, the dropdown arrows, text color, and backgrounds.Â The Calendar is using the MS Colorful 1 and MS Colorful 2 presets.

data.name: DropDownCalendars_Description4
data.value: Add to YourPage a WebCalendar which will be shared by all WebDateTimeEditors

data.name: DropDownCalendars_Description5
data.value: Copy "ig_dropCalendar.js" file to the location of YourPage.aspx

data.name: DropDownCalendars_Description7
data.value:
At the end of YourPage.aspx add <SCRIPT> block (or use RegisterStartupScript) with following
* Call to the function ig_initDropCalendar and pass String param
* Param: ID of calendar and IDs of all editors separated by Space
* If controls are within NamingContainers, then use UniqueIDs instead of IDs
* Example:
ig_initDropCalendar("WebCalendar1 WebDateTimeEdit1 WebDateTimeEdit2")

data.name: DropDownCalendars_Description8
data.value: Note: this application also has an example with another custom stand-alone date-editor and another drop-down calendar. That example explicitly adds ClientSideEvents to those controls and relies on functions located in the "ig_editDrop1.js" file

data.name: DropDownCalendars_Label1
data.value: Example of Date Editor with Drop-Down Calendar

data.name: DropDownCalendars_Label2
data.value: Access Keys = Underline Letters (like: L in Left Top), Press Alt + L to highlight the Drop Down Calendar Control in the Top Left.

data.name: DropDownGrid_Description1
data.value:
This sample shows how client side events of WebTextEdit and UltraWebGrid can be used to establish drop-down functionality.
Note: The drop-down grid appears as child control of document rather than as a top-window frame.

data.name: DropDownGrid_Description3
data.value:
Set <SCRIPT src="ig_editDrop2.js" ...> or use RegisterClientScriptBlock
  • All function names and content of ig_editDrop2.js can be customized
  • All functionality from ig_editDrop2.js can be moved under aspx
  • To hide UltraWebGrid in designer use: style="DISPLAY:none; ..."

data.name: DropDownGrid_Description4
data.value:
ClientSideEvents property of drop-down UltraWebGrid:
  • Set InitializeLayoutHandler to "initGridEvent"
  • Set CellClickHandler to "cellClickEvent"

data.name: DropDownGrid_Description5
data.value:
ClientSideEvents property of WebTextEdit(s):
  • Set CustomButtonPress to "openDropDownEvent"
  • Set KeyDown to "closeDropDownEvent" (optional)
  • Set Focus to "closeDropDownEvent" (optional)

data.name: DropDownGrid_Header
data.value: Text Editors - Drop Down Web Grid

data.name: DropDownGrid_Label1
data.value: Example of Text Editor with Drop-Down WebGrid

data.name: DropDownGrid_Label2
data.value: Access Keys = Underline Letters (like: L in Left Top), Press Alt + L to highlight the Drop Down Calendar Control in the Top Left. Firefox users, press Shift + ALT + L

data.name: MaskedEditors_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the functionality of the  WebMaskEdit Input controls

data.name: MaskedEditors_Description2
data.value: Enter a first name and last name.  Notice when the control is clicked the user is shown the length of characters this field will allow.

data.name: MaskedEditors_Description3
data.value: Enter a telephone number.  Notice this field also accepts the extension for office numbers.

data.name: MaskedEditors_Description4
data.value: Enter a social security number.  Notice that this field will only allow numbers, no alpha characters are accepted.

data.name: MaskedEditors_Description5
data.value: Enter a state.  Notice that this field will only allow alpha characters, no numbers are accepted.  This field also limits the amount of characters to 2.

data.name: MaskedEditors_Description6
data.value: Enter notes.   Notice this field is limited to a few characters

data.name: NumericEdit_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the WebNumericEdit control. This control can be used in many ways. In this sample notice the nullable vs. not nullable controls.

data.name: NumericEdit_Description2
data.value: Delete the content in the "Not Nullable" controls.  Notice the control is reset to the default value.

data.name: NumericEdit_Ranges-10to30
data.value: Range of values: from -10 to 30, SpinWrap is enabled

data.name: Styles_Description1
data.value: This sample demontrates the versatility to the WebDataInput Controls.

data.name: Styles_Description2
data.value: Make changes to each control.  Notice the differences and the wide range of functionality for each control.

data.name: Styles_Description3
data.value: Compare the differences between the asp controls vs. Infragistic controls.

data.name: Styles_Description4
data.value: *helpful hints when using controls, select a preset, then make the minor changes to make it your own.

data.name: Styles_PostbackPopup3
data.value: \n\nDo you want to postback page to server?

data.name: Validators_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the use of ASP.NET validation controls with WebDataInput Controls.

data.name: Validators_Description2
data.value: Add valid and invalid content into the fields

data.name: Validators_Error2
data.value: Value should be in range of 20-10000

data.name: WebCurrencyEditorDescription
data.value: This sample demonstrates basic using of WebCurrencyEditor control. By default the control makes round to two signs after decimal point. After you enter value and click outside of the control it adds currency sign. WebCurrecyEditor doesn't accept typing letters - only numbers.

data.name: WebCurrencyEditorLocalizationDescription
data.value: This sample demonstrates how to change the culture used by the WebCurrencyEditor control.

data.name: WebCurrencyEditorLocalizationTitle
data.value: Setting The Culture Used by the WebCurrencyEditor Control

data.name: WebDateInput_Description1
data.value: This sample demonstrates the WebDataInput controls Server Side Event Functionality.

data.name: WebDateInput_Description2
data.value: Change the Date/Time field.  Try valid and invalid information.

data.name: WebDateInput_Description3
data.value: Change the Currency field. Try valid and invalid information.

data.name: WebDateInput_Description4
data.value: Change Mask Edit field.  Try valid and invalid information.

data.name: WebDateInput_Label1
data.value: Server Side Events in DataInput Editors

data.name: WebDatePickerEditorDescription
data.value: This sample demonstrates how to setup the WebDatePicker control to use the WebMonth Calendar in a drop down.

data.name: WebDateTimeEditorDescription
data.value: This sample demonstrates the date/time editing, range, nullable, and prompts features of the WebDateTimeEditor control.

data.name: WebDateTimeEditorLocalizationDescription
data.value: This sample demonstrates how to change the culture used by the WebDateTimeEditor control.

data.name: WebDateTimeEditorLocalizationTitle
data.value: Setting The Culture Used by the WebDateTimeEditor Control

data.name: WebDateTimeEditorRestrictingByRange_Description
data.value: This sample demonstrates how you can specify a date range for the WebDateTimeEditor control , the control will not accept dates beyond the specified range.

data.name: WebEditorMaskBasicDesc
data.value: This sample demonstrates the mask editing features of the WebMaskEditor control.

data.name: WebEditorMaskBuildDesc
data.value: This sample demonstrates how to build your own mask input and use it with the WebMaskEditor control.

data.name: WebEditorMaskBuildDesc2
data.value:
Default value is set to "CCCCCCCCCCCC".
The mask may contain literal characters and input-mask-flags such as
  • & - any keyboard character (entry is required)
  • L - letter (entry is required)
  • 0, # - digit (entry is required)
  • A - letter or digit (entry is required)
  • C - any keyboard character (entry is optional)
  • ? - letter (entry is optional)
  • 9 - digit (entry is optional)
  • a - letter or digit (entry is optional)
  • > - all letters to the right are converted to the upper case
  • < - all letters to the right are converted to the lower case
Notes:
  • If in front of any flag-character appears the "\" (escape) character, then that character becomes the literal part of mask. For example, if mask is set to the "A\A\BB\\##\99" and control has no data, then text in edit mode will appear as "_A\BB\#_9_". Where the "_" are available positions for entry.
  • To cancel upper/lower case convertion which was set by the > or < flag, that flag should be used one more time. For example, if mask is set to the ">CC->CC->CC" and user entered the "XxXxXx", then resulting text should appear as "XX-Xx-XX".

data.name: WebEditorStylesDescription
data.value: This sample demonstrates how to apply different styles\themes to the WebEditor Controls.

data.name: WebEditors_ClientInteraction_Description
data.value: This sample demonstrates how to use the Client API to get the selected text from all Controls.

data.name: WebEditorValidationDescription
data.value: This sample demonstrates how to use the WebEditor controls in conjuction with the ASP.NET Validator controls.

data.name: WebNumericEditorDesc
data.value: This sample demonstrates basic using of WebNumericEditor control. By default the control makes round to two signs after decimal point. WebNumericEditor doesn't accept typing letters - only numbers.

data.name: WebNumericEditorRangeDesc
data.value: This sample demonstrates how to use JavaScript to restrict the range of values.

data.name: WebNumericEditorRangeTitle
data.value: Using the WebNumericEditor Control Restricting By Range

data.name: WebPercentEditorDesc
data.value: This sample demonstrates basic using of WebPercentEditor control. By default the control makes round to two signs after decimal point. After you enter value and click outside of the control it adds percent sign after the value. WebPercentEditor doesn't accept typing letters - only numbers.

data.name: WebTextEditorPasswordDesc
data.value: This sample demonstrates how to use the password mode of the WebPercentEditor control to build a login screen.

data.name: WebTextEditorUsingBasicDesc
data.value: This sample demonstrates the text editing, range, nullable, and spin button features of the WebTextEditor control. JavaScript is used to retrieve the text and current starting/ending selected text postions from the control.

data.name: WebTextEditorUsingMultiDesc
data.value: This sample demonstrates the multi line text editing features of the WebTextEditor control. JavaScript is used to retrieve the text and current starting/ending selected text postions from the control.

data.value: [can be canceled or keyCode can be changed]

data.value:
WebDateTimeEdit4 has invalid date

Instant values of fields:
year=
